be.florien.databasecomplexjoins.architecture

Class DBTable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.florien.databasecomplexjoins.architecture.DBData<T>
      • be.florien.databasecomplexjoins.architecture.DBTable<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - POJO representing the table, which will get the info from the database at the end of the parsing

    public abstract class DBTable<T>
extends be.florien.databasecomplexjoins.architecture.DBData<T>
    DBData representing the requests concerning a table in the database. An id referring to this table as a foreign key can be substituted in the model object by the Object constructed by this DBTable. This class provide methods to:
    • handle the selection of fields
    • handle the join of this table with all queried tables
    • convert the information provided by the database into the object's fields. Note that these fields could be a single Object or a List of said Object.
    Each implementation class will provide methods to:
    • select the fields to be present in the resulting object
    • join the possible tables referenced to this one, preferably using getJoinOnId or getJoinOnRef
    PLEASE BE CAREFUL The POJO T, result of the conversion, must have its fields'names corresponding exactly to one of the following:
    • the names of the table field
    • the other table's name if the object's field is another POJO created from database
    • the alias specified for this parser by setAlias
    Author:
    Florien Flament

    • Method Detail

      • setAlias

        public void setAlias(java.lang.String aliasName)
        Set an alias for this table. Said alias could be use in case where:
        • a POJO contains more than one occurrence of another table's POJO
        • the table is referenced multiple times in the JOIN statement, creating confusion for the request
        Parameters:
        aliasName - The alias that will be set for the table in the request AND used to retrieve the POJO's field to assign the value

      • selectId

        public abstract DBTable<T> selectId()
        Add the ID to the query. Implementation of this class must use selectId(String).
        Returns:
        this instance of DBTable

      • getId

        protected abstract java.lang.String getId()
        Return the column name for this table id without the table name or its alias
        Returns:
        The column name for this table id

      • getJoinToInnerTable

        protected abstract java.lang.String getJoinToInnerTable(DBTable<?> innerTable)
        Construct and return the join statement to join this table and the one in parameter, preferably using getJoinOnId, getJoinOnRef. Constructing and returning the join statement manually is also supported, but it should be kept in mind that this table could have been assigned to an alias, and thus getDataName should be used to get the table's name or alias.
        Parameters:
        innerTable - The DBTable representing a POJO which is present in this DBTable's POJO. Implementation of this method should test which table it represent and return the according JOIN statement.
        Returns:
        The JOIN statement

      • getJoinOnId

        protected java.lang.String getJoinOnId(DBTable<?> innerTable,
                           java.lang.String innerTableRef,
                           boolean isLeftJoin)
        Construct and return a JOIN statement where innerTable contain a reference to this table ID
        Parameters:
        innerTable - The table to join to this one
        innerTableRef - The columnName which refer to this table ID, without the table's name
        Returns:
        The JOIN statement in the form "JOIN INNER_TABLE [AS INNER_TABLE_ALIAS] ON TABLE.ID = INNER_TABLE[_ALIAS].INNER_TABLE_REF"

      • getJoinOnRef

        protected java.lang.String getJoinOnRef(DBTable<?> innerTable,
                            java.lang.String thisTableRef,
                            boolean isLeftJoin)
        Construct and return a JOIN statement where this table contain a reference to innerTable ID
        Parameters:
        innerTable - The table to join to this one
        thisTableRef - The columnName which refer to the innerTable ID, without the table's name
        Returns:
        The JOIN statement in the form "JOIN INNER_TABLE [AS INNER_TABLE_ALIAS] ON TABLE.THIS_TABLE_REF = INNER_TABLE[_ALIAS].ID"

      • getJoinComplete

        public java.lang.String getJoinComplete()
        Construct and return the JOIN statement for this table and all its inner tables. This method should be used uniquely if this DBTable is not a inner DBData.
        Returns:
        The complete JOIN statement for the query

      • getOrderByForThis

        protected java.lang.String getOrderByForThis()
        Return a column name in the form "TABLE_ALIAS.COLUMN_NAME". Override this method if you want the sorting to be another column than the ID (Default). But be careful as the datas from a single object must be in consecutive rows in the query result.
        Returns:
        A column name in the form "TABLE_ALIAS.COLUMN_NAME"

      • getResult

        public java.util.List<T> getResult(Cursor cursor)
        Extract the datas from the Cursor in parameter and return a List of POJO filled with queried fields
        Parameters:
        cursor - The cursor which has received the datas from the database.
        Returns:
        a List of POJO

      • getFieldToSet

        protected java.lang.reflect.Field getFieldToSet(be.florien.databasecomplexjoins.architecture.DBData<?> fieldToSet)
                                         throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Return the Field which will be used by the parser to set the value to the correct filed in the POJO. Retrieve said field by using the columnName or the alias is one is set. Override this method if you want the POJO's field name and the columnName/alias to be different.
        Parameters:
        fieldToSet - Representation for retrieving the data from the database. Used to get the POJO field name
        Returns:
        The Field to be set
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException

      • getFieldToSet

        protected java.lang.reflect.Field getFieldToSet(java.lang.String fieldToSet)
                                         throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Return the Field which will be used by the parser to set the value to the correct filed in the POJO. Retrieve said field by using the field to set. Override this method if you want the POJO's field name and fieldToSet to be different.
        Parameters:
        fieldToSet - The POJO field name
        Returns:
        The Field to be set
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException

        Description copied from class: be.florien.databasecomplexjoins.architecture.DBData

        Specified by:
        extractRowValue in class be.florien.databasecomplexjoins.architecture.DBData<T>
        Parameters:
        cursor - The Cursor from which the selected field/table will be converted
        column - Represent the column number where the selected field/table is stored in the Cursor
